article.headline: Trump being taken to Walter Reed as a precaution after contracting coronavirus
article.body: The White House said late Friday afternoon that President Donald Trump would spend a “few days” at a military hospital on the advice of his physicians after contracting COVID-19. Trump was set to depart the White House by helicopter for Walter Reed National Military Medical Center. The White House said that the visit is precautionary and that Trump will work from the hospital’s presidential suite, which is equipped to allow him to continue his official duties. There has been no discussion of a turnover of presidential powers to the vice president, Mike Pence, NBC News national politics reporter Carol Lee reported. The Margin:Trump posts video update on Twitter before boarding Marine One for trip to Walter Reed Earlier Friday the White House said Trump remains “fatigued” and had been injected with an experimental antibody drug combination for the virus, which as of Friday has killed more than 205,000 Americans and spread to the highest reaches of the U.S. government. MarketWatch contributed.
